str2: Slothful, backward, hesitating; of things: irksome. From okneo; tardy, i.e. Indolent; irksome.
(a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and krino; to conclude for oneself, i.e. to respond; by Hebraism to begin to speak.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular

str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To reap, gather, harvest. From theros; to harvest.
Where, whither, in what place. From hos and pou; what(-ever) where, i.e. At whichever spot.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To sow, spread, scatter. Probably strengthened from spao; to scatter, i.e. Sow.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From sun and ago; to lead together, i.e. Collect or convene; specially, to entertain.
From hos with the directive enclitic of source; from which place or source or cause.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From dia and skorpizo; to dissipate, i.e. to rout or separate; specially, to winnow; figuratively, to squander.
